data.title: Cute little place and tasty wines!
data.text: My husband fell in love with the ports at a local wine festival, so we had to visit! There are lots of wines to choose from! They have reds, whites, fruits, and desserts! They also have wine slushies! Everyone is so nice and it was an enjoyable visit. We will be back!

data.title: Sweet Sipping Winery
data.text: We decided to try out Cabo's winery in downtown Concord, we were pleasantly surprised with the great wines and lovely atmosphere. Some wineries give you the tasting glasses and Cabo's also gives you your wine tasting glasses. Our host was pleasant, funny and a wealth of knowledge about the wines they had to serve. A nice surprise is you get to choose the wines you want to taste instead of being given a set of standard wines. But I'm not done yet! Lots of cute shopping areas, and once a month they have a wine tasting and painting offered to anyone that wants to sign up for it. This is a must stop for wine tasting lovers.

data.title: A flavorfull array of different wines
data.text: OK, so Concord isn't NAPA.  However, this place has a fun and somewhat funky book of wines.  Most are of the sweeter styles but many have unique fruit flavors.  Always great to have some of these sippers in the fridge for drop in guests.  The owners always try to make sure your experience is pleasant and informative.  Just another reason to make Downtown Concord a destination stop.

data.title: Very Impressed
data.text: What a great experience in tasting wine, not to mention the warm welcome received in this downtown Concord winery, well worth the drive from neighboring Charlotte.   We were tended by one of the owners who made sure that we not only enjoyed the whole wine tasting experience, but that we felt like friends upon parting.  Although this winery is located on Union Street, its definitely Main Street, USA.  As for the wines themselves, excellent!!!    Looking forward to our next visit.

data.title: My first wine tasting
data.text: This was my first wine experience and boy was it one to remember. Their wines tasted so amazing. From the time I walked in and the warm welcome I received from the staff was so refreshing . My co-workers and I talked about this place all day! We can't wait to come to the sip and paint party in July.  We are rounding up the girls now! I also plan to GET MORE WINE!! I came just yesterday and my bottle is more than halfway gone! 🙁 my boyfriend and brother loved the bottle I brought home. I definitely will be back to get more! Some of my favorites were side porch, hissy fit, and amazing grace. Check them out!!

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Our first visit and will not be our last.  Mr. BO, Mrs. Steele and family were outstanding host.  We loved every sample...we took home 2 bottles of Hissy Fit, 1 of Bless Your Heart aka O MY Goodness, Amazing Grace and Honey Hush.  We can't wait to try them all.   Best thing in Concord ever!

data.title: Wonderful Saturday Afternoon
data.text: Visited Cabo Winery at the spur of the moment, and we are so glad we did.  I have never been to a tasting where all of the wines sampled were good.  The atmosphere is friendly and relaxed. No stuff shirt snobbery here.   The wines are unique, the flavors distinct and do not blend on one another during the tasting.  The hardest decision is which ones to try and which ones to buy.  Cabo Winery is definitely on my repeat list.

data.title: Great Place in Downtown Concord
data.text: We visited the winery after visiting another one near this location. The building is beautiful and we enjoyed tasting several wonderful wines. There is A LOT of options and between my wife and I, we tried around 20. There are options for everyone to enjoy. We focused mainly on the sweeter side of their selection and enjoyed the experience. They have a wonderful warm wine that is premixed with mulling spices. We look forward to returning!

data.title: Relatively new Neighborhood Winery
data.text: Cabo is less than a year old. It is located in an old building on Union Street in downtown Concord.  We did a wine tasting with one of the owners.  They offer over 70 wines  ranging from dry to sweet.  We concentrated on the dry wines.  Although some of the wines are a bit immature, we found several that we could definitely enjoy.  We felt that several of the wines could benefit from oak barrel (not chips) aging.  However, we were told that, because of limits and regulations imposed by local agencies, they are very limited in their methods of aging - they use a few tanks and the rest is aged in glass - a new one for us. We liked their Merlot and their blend called Trio.  Their filtered Malbec is quite nice (they also have a non-filtered and it is not as smooth).  While it is worth a visit if you happen to be in the area, and we recommend you do, we look forward to seeing how this business and their wines develop and over the next couple of years.  We hope they find an alternative location where they can properly age their wines in barrels without limitations.
